What is the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and how does it work?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace is a decentralized platform where you can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs (non-fungible tokens) directly on the blockchain. You can advertise your offer to the owner of an ID or NFT, or post the sale of your NFT for the entire world to see. Transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, allowing you to pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address. You can also accept payment to either type of address, and execute transactions directly, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.

What is Verus Vault, and how does it protect my funds?

Verus Vault is a feature that allows you to protect funds on a VerusID, even if your private key is stolen. When you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity until it is unlocked again. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn rewards. You can also still receive funds. However, it is important to note that enabling Verus Vault capabilities requires you to have at least one primary identity and one revocation/recovery ID configured.

What are the benefits of using Verus Vault to protect my funds?

The benefits of using Verus Vault include the ability to protect your funds from theft, even if your private key is compromised. Additionally, you can still earn rewards by staking your locked funds on the Verus network, and you can still receive funds while your VerusID is locked. Overall, Verus Vault provides an additional layer of security and flexibility for managing your funds on the Verus network.

What are the requirements for using Verus Vault?

To use Verus Vault, you must have at least one primary identity and one revocation/recovery ID configured. This means you need to have a primary VerusID and a separate ID set up as a revocation and recovery authority in order to enable Verus Vault capabilities.
